timeline.bodyText:
It looks like the removal of @RestController causes the following DataAccessTokenControllerTest.revokeAllTokensForUserTest() failure:
Running org.cbioportal.web.DataAccessTokenControllerTest Tests run: 7, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 17.534 sec <<< FAILURE! revokeAllTokensForUserTest(org.cbioportal.web.DataAccessTokenControllerTest)  Time elapsed: 0.772 sec  <<< ERROR! javax.servlet.ServletException: Circular view path [data-access-tokens]: would dispatch back to the current handler URL [/data-access-tokens] again. Check your ViewResolver setup ! (Hint: This may be the result of an unspecified view, due to default view name generation.)      
After some digging, I think its because @RestController included @responsebody which is required to properly unmarshal into JSON.  Adding @responsebody after @RequestMapping should solve this issue.
